DESCRIPTOR.STUDY_ABSTRACT:
The types of biomarkers for skin tumors have been 1) biochemical markers in blood, urine, and body fluid, 2) 
histopathological markers, 3) genetic examination of tumor tissue, 4) tumor-susceptibility assessed by germ_x0002_line genetic examination. Biomarkers in a blood are frequently used in the treatment of cutaneous 
malignancies, but are not suitable for early detection of malignancies. Research on circulating tumor cells, cell 
free DNA, exosomes has been promoted in recent years, but clinical application is halfway. Based on these 
circumstances, the purpose of this study is to search for biomarkers for diagnosis, therapeutic effect, and 
follow-up of skin tumors, and to verify their usefulness.

title: Amplicon sequencing of melanoma samples
